news_header: At least 211 people have died in floods in Spain, with many still missing.
news_text: Devastating floods in southern Spain have resulted in at least 211 fatalities and dozens of people are still unaccounted for. The Spanish Meteorological Institute has issued a 'red warning' for heavy rainfall, predicting up to 9 centimeters per hour. Residents are advised to stay home, particularly in the Almerian province, as the floods have caused significant destruction, including overturned vehicles and collapsed buildings. This disaster marks the deadliest natural event in Spain in decades.
